text: A hot summer's day. Heat ripples distorts the towering sh buildings in the dense smog.

An earthquake measuring 9.6 on the Richter scale hits at 12:59 p.m., August 23rd, in the year 2000. Suddenly we are hit by the loudest, booming, rolling conc you have ever heard. The buildings begin to shake, swayin The Bonaventure Hotel implodes, collapses inward in the t slamming freight train of an earthquake. The 4-level Inte as the Santa Monica Freeway shatters, crumbles, pulling e ramps, cars, trees, and nearby buildings with it.
Buildings shaking. Streets buckling. Cars rolling, crashi People running. Gas mains exploding. Buildings convulsing dropping like tinder against an inferno.
As the tsunami sweeps in from the ocean, smacking into th shoreline like the hammer of God, plunging us into darkne
After the devastation, the constitution is damned, and the newly elected President accepts a lifetime term of office.
Of the United States. A line tracks along the Mexican bor the Berlin Wall.
Fearing a massive terrorist invasion from South America, the United States prepares for war. The Great Wall is built along the southern border, cutting off the flow of illegal aliens.
The ruins of L.A. Rubble, smoke, a lethal wasteland. An a terrifying figures climbs atop a mountain of debris. They their weapons into the night sky.
Street gangs, South American terrorists and the criminally insane capture Los Angeles, the once-great City of Angels.
An unrecognizable L.A. After the big one. Surrounded by w L.A. is now an island off the new western shore, tilting edge of the continental plate.

Now an island on the border of civilization, L.A. is a no-man's land of chaos, anarchy and darkness. A red line tracks along the mountainous areas surrounding island, defining the perimeter of the armed fortress. Pol firebases and gun emplacements are indicated in the San G Mountains.
The United States Police Force, like an army, is encamped in the San Gabriel Mountains. ZOOM INTO L.A. From the glowing, outlined canyons come the cries of rage million lost souls.
The President's first act as Permanent Commander-in-Chief is Directive 17: protect and defend the United States from this island of the damned, Hell on Earth.

TRAVELING SHOT low, across the top of the water's surface up the side of a massive, rusted supertanker, abandoned, ago. Break over the railing to reveal a gigantic neon sig screams "NEW LAS VEGAS." The supertanker has been transfo a floating resort. The camera increases speed, moves past huge billboards di gigantic glitzy ads: "NUCLEAR NIGHTS IN HAVANA" - an extravaganza with fabulou showgirls and laser recreations of Fidel's final night. "MUSEUM OF NIGHT CLUB ARTS" - a virtual reality tour feat legendary Vegas entertainers. "FREE ENTERPRISE WORLD" - a virtual Disneyland for the wh family. Now camera flies low through glittering streets and back filled with gamblers, neon and glitz.
An alley strangled with tourists, gamblers, hookers, hust con men - professional expatriates from the West mingling excited visitors from all over the world.

A Salesman with a chin-mike speaks non-stop, unintelligib Chinese. A frenzied crowd gathers around him, waving mone placing bets. Two men sit at either end of a long table. They are in de shadows, facing each other. We only get glimpses of them: Mirrored sunglasses. Chinese. His fingers tap on the tabl cockroach scurries past. Ammo belts. A sheathed combat kn size of your arm. .45 automatics in holsters. The other, dressed in black. An eye-patch. Dangerous. A f two six-guns in holsters. A futuristic gunfighter. The co dashes past his fingers. WHAP! He squashes it. The crowd goes nuts, placing bets, yelling and screaming dozen languages. The salesman places three different shaped, clear shot gl front of the two men. Then he leans over to... A VAT OF POISONOUS SNAKES. He reaches in, grabs a cobra, out. The cobra hisses and squirms. Deftly, the salesman c to talk non-stop into his chin-mike as he milks the cobra into the first glass. He pulls out an ice-pick, jabs it into the snake's throat bleeds a thick green-white liquid into the second glass. he slits open the cobra with a large knife, and cuts out and liver. Tossing aside the dead snake, the salesman squ heart and liver with his fingers. The juice drips into th glass. Now the salesman stirs the glasses. The poison is clear. is milky-green. The heart and liver are red. He places th on the table between the two men. The two men stare at each other, motionless. The crowd co placing bets at a fevered pitch. A titanium white tube fl above the center of the table. A laser beam of light shin one end. The salesman leans over and flicks on side with his finge sending the tube spinning on its axis like a bottle, the circling the room before stopping on the fat man's forehe The fat man reaches slowly toward the glasses. His hand s slightly. He hesitates. Finally he takes the glass with t liquid (the heart and liver), lifts it to his lips, pause gulps it down. The crowd explodes. More bets. The salesman leans over and spins the light tube again, t it lands on something black, an eye-patch. Pull back to r man with an eye-patch. The man with the eye-patch reaches forward, his hand paus between the remaining two glasses. He takes the one fille milky-green blood and downs it fast. The crowd roars. One glass left. The two men stare at it intently. The salesman spins the light tube with more force than be circles again and again, slowing down, speeding up, final stopping on the fat man. The salesman begins yelling over the din of the crowd, sh the fat man. The fat man reaches for the glass of clear p His trembling fingers hover above it. Then he quickly wit his hand. The crowd reacts, boos, as... The man with the eye-patch smiles. A slightly, cynical sm without hesitation, he reaches out, grabs the glass of po drinks it down. The crowd surges forward, but the salesma them with a sweep of his arm. All bets are off. The two men stand from the table. Take several steps away the end of the alley. Stand facing each other. Two gunfig Flashes of the two men. A piece of a black military boot. positioned over a six-shooter. Mirrored sunglasses. A swe trembling lip. And the eye-patched man's one good eye, bl clear, staring - hard and calm as a sunny day... The draw. It happens in an instant. The alley thunders wi gunfire. The guns buck and flash. Then silence. The two m there for a beat, until one of them, the fat man, slumps, face first into the alley, dead. The crowd goes completely ape shit as SNAKE PLISSKEN emer the shadows of the alley, holsters his guns, grabs his ta money... SNAKE PLISSKEN. Long hair. A black eye-patch. A tight-lip grimace. The impression of coiled aggression and intense The toughest, most dangerous man on planet earth. A legen PLISSKEN strolls out of the alley into the crowd. He coun money, pockets it, as a cigarette girl approaches him. PL stops her, pays for a pack of cigs. As she eyes him...

... the cigarette girl touches him, pricks his skin with fingernail. A drop of blood appears. PLISSKEN turns, stares after her, as the sound of helicop rises from above in the night sky. The crowd suddenly sta disperse. Helicopter searchlights blast down on the street. PLISSKE suddenly caught in the glare. He starts to move away...

Out of the blackness above a huge steel net drops out of The net slams down on top of PLISSKEN, trapping him, driv down to the pavement with its weight... PLISSKEN struggle the net as black figures - United States Police Force Off rush toward him, grab the net, tightening it. More cops m him as we SLOWLY FADE TO BLACK...

Searchlights sweep down across a column of policemen marc a concrete wall. Camera begins to crane up the wall. Soun roaring turbines. The howl of the Santa Ana wind. Camera reaches the top of the wall. Armed police troops s the battlements. Across what looks like an ocean is L.A. is from the Newhall Pass. Hidden by the Santa Monica Mountains, L.A. glows in the d with a hundred fires. Smoke surges from the jagged horizo the sky is an angry orange.
Res sensor lights glow in evenly spaced intervals. Search sweep into the darkness. Cannons are in place every 200 f manned by police guards.

Water stretches into blackness. This was once the San Fer Valley, but now it's all underwater. Pieces of debris - t buildings, the tail of an airplane, a radio tower - stick the surface. We can make out the letters of an old, half- sign: "SAN FERNANDO VALLEY MALL"
The wall stretches to the northwest up to the Santa Susan Portions of the 118 Freeway arch up out of the water.

Firebase Seven is a fortified base camp in the San Gabrie Mountains. It is a sprawling police complex with low conc bunkers, gun emplacements, satellite communications, vehi troops, the works. ON A LARGE ASPHALT FIELD, opposite the complex is Rotor City - row after row of black, multi-bla totally evil police battle helicopters parked like giant the ground. A throng of policemen gather at the edge of Rotor City ye cheering, their fists in the air. Cops with camcorders vi the event. A police anchor reports...

He's been the Force's Most Wanted Man for 10 years. Convicted of 27 moral crimes. I can tell you, the excitement around here is... (a great roaring skyward) Here he comes! A MASSIVE 7-ROTORED, 40-BLADED HELICOPTER TRANSPORT comes down out of the black sky and lands. The growing crowd of cops goes nuts like fans at a football game. They slap ha dance wildly.

A mammoth room filled with high-tech instrumentation. A g holographic map of L.A. fills one wall. Most of the contr personnel have left their work stations and gather around all showing the Police Channel: a view of the helicopter sitting on the asphalt and the cheering crowds at the edg Rotor City. A tall, steel-faced officer sits at his desk. This is Fir Commander MAC "BIG DOG" MALLOY. Hard, battle weary featur BRAZEN, a section Lieutenant, comes up.
Commander Malloy. They're bringing him out, sir. Malloy rises from his chair, steps to a nearby TV set, wa scene from the Police Channel.
So we finally got him.
The crowd of cops is growing to a frenzy of wild anticipa

Hold one! The door is opening! The door of the helicopter transport slowly lowers like a drawbridge. Out of its black belly comes... SNAKE PLISSKEN. A steel collar is clamped around his neck lengths of chain stretch to eight armed guards who escort down the ramp. Plissken is bruised, badly beaten and tort face a mess, but he doesn't seem to care. A line of battl cops stand with their guns aimed right at Plissken's head marched into camp. An army of camcorders move ahead of th Anchor as he scampers along in front of PLISSKEN, intervi him.
Hello, Plissken. Welcome to L.A. Celebrating cops cheer as Plissken is lead to...

head_text.subj: A SIGN ABOVE A CONCRETE BUNKER

text: The bunker has one large opening, into which hundreds of march. Guards in towers monitor the condemned as they tru of fenced-in containment areas, down walled corridors to bunker entrance. The deportees are minorities, the poor, prostitutes, pimp thieves, adulterers, atheists - the Morally Guilty, outca society. Single mothers carry babies. Teenage runaways hu together. There are abortion doctors, drug dealers, porno the prisoners of a massive cultural war. As Plissken is marched toward the entrance, a loudspeaker out:
You are now entering the Deportation Center. You have been found guilty of moral crimes against the United States of America. A great cheer goes up from the cops as the Police Anchor his interview...
S.D. Bob Plissken. Special Forces, Black Light, Texas Thunder. Two Purple Hearts. Youngest man ever decorated by the President. Plissken's face remains so impassive as to be almost blan
A glowing, vaporous-orange corridor. More cops gather to Plissken as he is escorted into the bowels of the Deporta Center.
You've been convicted of 27 moral crimes, Plissken. The murder of an Internal Revenue agent. The kidnapping of a bank president. Gun fighting for profit. The list goes on and on...

Deeper into the Deportation Center. Camera tracks along t deportees, some bleeding, some wrapped in rags. Plissken, Police Anchor, camcorders and the armed escort move throu dark, low concrete passageway.
You used to respect the law. Served your country like no man before you. Role model to a generation. The Police Anchor leans in as close as he dares to Plissk face.
What happened to you, war hero? You were the best we had.
Steel walls. Deeper into the Deportation Center. The depo here are in worse shape. Some appear to be dead. Plissken entourage continue along, as the speaker echoes a pre-rec message...

You are sentenced to permanent expulsion beyond the borders of the U.S. You now have the option to repent of your sins and be electrocuted on the premises. If you elect this option, notify the Cleric Sergeant in your Processing Area. Plissken and his entourage pass deportees kneeling and pr front of cloaked cleric cops, government holy men. Beyond opened doorways, see Death Row deportees being strapped i futuristic electric chairs.
The whole world's watching. Every good and decent person who works and hard and follows the rules. What would say to them? Plissken's expression is blank.
What would you say to all of us who believed in you, who looked up to you, who thought you stood for right over wrong, good over evil? Be my guest. What do you have to say, Plissken?
(beat) Call me Snake. The guards move Plissken through a doorway, and the huge doors slam shut on the Police Anchor and the camcorders.
Malloy, Brazen, and a 3rd man, tall, charismatic, grim, m urgently along a corridor.
ComStat did a psychosearch on him. Used a database of 5 million sociopathic personalities. He hit the bottom of the curve.
Perfect for the mission. Nobody else can pull it off - not an army, not a man.
Zero emotional developments. Total lack of compassion. A highly developed psychopathic instinct to survive.
Let's get this over with.

The cell door slams shut. Plissken turns around. Writ and irons. He looks around. In the concrete cell he sees a simple table with an overh above it. A watch lies on the table. Plissken shuffles ov up the watch, examines it. The cell door opens. Malloy, Brazen, and the 3rd Man ente room unarmed. The door closes. Malloy and Brazen move forward, to the edge of the light. Man stays back in the shadows by the door.
How you doin' Plissken? (no reply) You like the watch?
You assholes didn't bring me here to give me this for 20 years of dedicated service. What'ya want? Malloy looks back to the 3rd Man in the shadows...
Get to it. Malloy raises a control unit, pushes the button. The ligh down and a computer-enhanced image appears on the wall...

From the point of view of a surveillance camera. The lab Banks of processors, disk drives, test bays, prototype as areas. High tech. A group of government officials is bein tour. Utopia, 17, the President's daughter is among them. virginal, she wears a "True Love Waits" button on her flo dress.

At 1030 hours Wednesday, a group of government officials began a tour of the Livermore Defense Lab. The President's daughter, Utopia, was among them. Plissken continues to watch the image on the wall...
An hour later, she boarded Air Force 3 to Washington. The 3rd Man reacts as the image in front of Plissken chan

From the point of view of a camcorder. Utopia stands insi main cabin of a plush, government 747. In one hand she ho black anodized box the size of a transistor radio with a top. In the other, a machine gun.
(to the camcorder) To the American people - it is time to rise up and demand the surrender of the President and his corrupt theocracy of lies and terror.

At 1140 hours, she hijacked the plane. We scanned the videotape on VR. Check it out. Inside the surveillance room the President stares grimly presses a button. Suddenly the image in front of Plissken out all around him. He is in a virtual reality re-creatio

Plissken stands manacled in the main cabin. A group of se service men and congressmen watch as a flight attendance a camcorder. He's videotaping Utopia as she rants into th She's pent up with such anxiety she's like a panther in a

Today is Day One of a brand new world. The days of the empire are finished. (beat) To the President - my father, you know what this is. She holds up the anodized box with the red button and thr at the camcorder.
You know what it will do. Unless you abdicate your throne by tomorrow night, I will use it - on you.
Utopia, please. Give us the prototype. If something should happen -
It will be in my hands - and the hands of my lover. She says "lover" with all the drama a 17-year-old virgin muster. The others are shocked.

Yes, my lover. My man. The only real man I've ever known. I'm on my way to his arms. She moves to the rear of the main cabin, bends down, open hatch in the floor, scrambles down... WHAM! The VR image suddenly disappears and Plissken is ag standing inside the concrete cell. Malloy and Brazen stan front of him.
Somehow during the tour, she came into possession of a prototype transmitting device. We don't know how.

Utopia became depressed after her mother's suicide, began to withdraw into her virtual reality simulator. She'd punch up her own little world in cyberspace and stay in it for days at a time. (hits a button) Somebody else was in there with her.

In front of Plissken: A computer-rendered VR picture of c sunshine, green grass and happy animals frolicking. A Gar Eden. There, coming toward us, is CUERVO JONES. South Ame terrorist. Fiercest warrior of the Third World. He wears gleaming ancient Aztec battle helmet. Bandoliers strapped him.

Cuervo Jones. Shining Path. Peruvian terrorist. Runs the biggest baddest gang in L.A. Cuervo Jones takes off the helmet He is blindingly handso charismatic. He smiles, reaches out his arms to camera as embrace it. The image suddenly pops back to the beginning on a loop. The image disappears. The lights in the cell come up.

Utopia made tapes of her VR experiences, then tried to erase them. She missed this fragment on the end of her last tape. Cuervo Jones must have tapped into the VR master data bank - and then went prowling around for innocent blood, someone vulnerable to corrupt. Utopia was lonely, looking for something to believe in.
Sad story. You got a cigarette?
Shut up, Plissken.
What's the little black box do?
Top secret. Only on a need to know.
And I don't need to know. So fuck you, I'm goin' to Hollywood.
That's right, big shot. Unless you do what we want you're not coming back.
So what's the deal, huh? Go into L.A., find the President's daughter, secure the box, and bring 'em both out - and I'm free?
That's the deal.
Tell the President to adopt. I think I'll like L.A. After a couple of beats, the 3rd Man appears next to Mall Brazen. He stares at Plissken for a moment, holds up some
If you bring out the prototype, you'll receive a full pardon for every immoral act you have ever committed in the United States. Just like in '97. Remember New York, Plissken?
(looks at him) Who are you?
It's the President, for Christ's sake!
I give you my word. Put the prototype into my hands, and you're a free man.
I can see you're real concerned about your daughter.
Utopia is lost to me. My daughter is gone.
Well, I'll think it over.
You're running out of time.
I've been doin' that all my life. Might as well do it in L.A. Everybody else there is.
Well, enjoy it, war hero, cause you got 10 hours to live. Malloy, Brazen, and the President turn to leave...
Wait a minute, what are you talkin' about?
Having second thoughts?
Maybe. But you're not putting any shit in me this time.
You don't understand. It's already in you.
As an image of the cigarette girl in New Las Vegas flashe suddenly. Her fingernail scratches his arm. He tightens.
The cigarette girl in New Vegas was an undercover cop. She injected you with incentive toxin. Right now it's swimming in your bloodstream. It'll start to take effect in 9 hours.

It's a strain of the Plutoxin 7 virus. Genetically engineered. 100% pure death. Complete nervous system shutdown. You crash and bleed out like a stuck pig. Not a pretty sight. Plissken takes a step toward him. Malloy holds up a large hypodermic.

Of course there's an anti-toxin. Neutralizes the virus immediately upon injection. (beat) We'll give it to you, but you have to do us this little favor. TWO BEATS... ...and then Plissken attacks the President, hurls himself the room, throwing the chain around the President's neck. Plissken passes right through the President, causing his waver slightly, then falls on his ass.
Didn't think we were that stupid, did you?
The real Malloy, Brazen, and President stand in front of camera in a small room offering a view of the cell throug transparent portion of the wall.
We're holographs.
Plissken stares at the three images in front of him, then camera lens on the wall...
Get this crap out of me.
I guess we have a deal. Nice to be working with you, Plissken.
(beat) Call me Snake.
Plissken checks through various tactical survival items a weapons laid out on a table. Brazen watches as Malloy sho high tech submachine gun.

Very sweet little weapon. Core burner. Magnesium ammo. 500 extra rounds. (moves on) Two 9mm handguns. (holds up a silver pill) Oral projectile. Mouth dart. Hold it in your mouth for ten seconds, the coating dissolves, it becomes a weapon. Malloy breaks open the silver pill. Inside is s small, le looking dart.
Urolite. It'll stun the enemy for several seconds. Plissken picks up a small, computerized compass.
Tracer. Utopia has a kidnap chip implanted in her arm. You can locate her with this. Brazen hands Plissken a large black clip.
This clips right onto your 9mm. Ammo enhancers. Like miniaturized grenades. Blows through anything. Plissken snaps the clip onto his pistol, then unsnaps it.
Plissken suits up. Submachine gun, handguns, six-guns. He and Malloy walk quickly across the complex.
L.A. is in a constant state of warfare. Gangs fighting for the right to rule.
Heavy Third World connections. They get weapons, drugs, fuel, choppers - everything is pumped into the island from the south.
Some areas have power - they're on line to San Onofre.
As Brazen's command helicopter takes off...
Plissken stares at a photo of the anodized prototype.
I'll need to know more about this thing.
Only a handful of people are aware of its existence. Let's just say it's the ultimate defensive weapon.
Defense against what?
There's a war about to be declared, or didn't you know? Plissken shrugs.

Third World wants to live like we do - and they plan on taking what they want. The Cubans and Brazilians are ready to invade Miami. If the Africans and Colombians make a run at the border, we got a full scale attack on the United States.
So what does this thing do?
All you need to know is get it back here by 5 a.m.
The Command helicopter lands near a large access tunnel i containment wall.
Plissken, Brazen and Malloy walk through the dark, dank t Armed guards stand at the ready. A hatch in the tunnel fl stands open. A ladder disappears down into the darkness.
(points to the open hatch) You're going over by submarine. One-man submersible. Nuclear powered. Plissken arranges his gear, climbs into the hatch opening
Where do I put ashore?

Cahuenga Pass. Make your way up through the mountains toward the Hollywood Bowl. You should be able to pick up Utopia's tracer there. (beat) Once you go inside, you're on your own. (beat) You know what you have to do with the girl, don't you? (beat) We have to spare this nation her trial - for treason.
So you want me to take her out? (Malloy nods) Is that an order from the President?
Let's just say it's what's best for the country.
By the way - who gives me the anti-toxin?
A medical team will be standing by.
Not you?
No.
Good. KABLAMM! He fires, ripping hellish blasts at Malloy. Ther damage. Malloy laughs.
Thought you might try that. First clip is filled with blanks. Goodbye, Plissken. Malloy kicks the hatch and it slams down on top of Plissk Brazen pushes a control button, sealing it shut.
Plissken climbs down the ladder into a small submarine ba him on a launching rig is a sleek, black one-man submarin like a dart. The submarine's hatch is open. Plissken clim inside.
Plissken seals the hatch behind him. He has to lie flat o stomach to operate the sub. He quickly hits various switc buttons, powering up the cockpit.
Malloy and Brazen move to a surveillance-command post.
Com check. Malloy picks up the microphone.
I'm here, Plissken.
Plissken looks at the wrist watch. It ticks down ominousl hours and counting down...
Stand by for launch. Ignitor. (Plissken pushes a button) Fuel rod injection. Plissken pulls a lever, watches his dials. A deep humming grows louder inside the sub.
She's in the green.
Lock fuel rods.
(hits a switch) Locked.
Nuclear turbine to 75% power. Plissken turns a throttle-like control with his left hand
Out of the rear tubes of Plissken's sub comes a roaring b
75% power.
Hands on switches and counting. 5...4...3...2...1. Launch.
The rear tubes roar. Suddenly the sub is shot forward thr long, circular tunnel.
Plissken braces himself as the cabin lurches, vibrates wi force.

A door in the wall opens, revealing the circulator tunnel roaring explosion, the sub rockets out of the tunnel, sho the wall like a cannonball. The submarine is airborne for seconds, then drops down, and slams into the San Fernando
Plissken is rocked with the impact. He guides the sub wit controls. In front of him on a screen is a schematic diag the underwater landscape of the San Fernando Valley.
In the underwater darkness, see the broken remains of the Freeway, as the subs creams past, its nuclear wake churni water.
Malloy, Brazen and other cops follow Plissken's course on gigantic computer screen.
Plissken, watch your speed. Lots of obstructions down there.
As the sub rockets past the ruins of the Van Nuys City Ha barely missing it.
Plissken... Plissken ignores him, carefully maneuvering the sub with controls.
Plissken... do you copy?
Camera follows the sub as it streaks along just above the submerged ruins of the Ventura Freeway. See the ghostly s cars, trucks, busses below, smashed and overturned.
They watch the sub, a red blip on the screen, move along freeway.
Plissken twists his hand throttle, pouring on the power t

The sub rips through the water, faster and faster, goes i hard bank to the right as the Ventura Freeway turns into Hollywood. A sign at the edge of the Hollywood Freeway re "SPEED LIMIT 55". The sub screams past.
Brazen points to a readout showing the submarine's engine
His reactor's starting to overheat.
Plissken, slow down the sub. You're overloading the power plant.
Plissken glances at the gauge. His nuclear turbine readou moving to yellow, into red. He pushes it up to 102%.
Plissken...? Plissken's eye turns back to the computer map in front of the screen: the red blip representing the sub is headed r toward a building. Plissken pulls hard on the controls.

The sub smacks into the side of the Black Tower, powers t it, blasts out the other side through a window, tilting a wobbling. The sub rights itself momentarily but is slamme downward out of frame by a huge, dark, slimy object. KING KONG looms overhead - his fist rising and falling wi currents. Plissken has maneuvered himself into the wrecka Universal Studios Tour. The sub zips through the King Kong ride into Back To The passing 1950's signage from that film, dodging a rusting It slams into the open mouth of JAWS, shattering the mode million pieces. The sub continues on, bouncing through the narrow opening Earthquake Ride - broken pipes, cracked sidewalks, split hard to tell what was the ride and what was The Big One.
Plissken hangs on, as small jets of water spray into the through tiny cracks in the hull.
The sub suddenly tips upward, rising for the surface.
The sub explodes out of the water, lands belly first on a with a hard thump.
Plissken presses the hatch controls. The sub begins to sl backwards down toward the water.

Plissken struggles, then rips open the hatch, scrambles o sub slowly slips backwards, down into the water. As the r exhaust tubes hit the surface, a blast of steam. Plissken out of the hatch. The sub sinks faster and faster. He sca the side, leaps for ground... and lands on the hillside, sub sinks into the sea, bubbling, churning, hissing. A bleeping sound. He takes out his pocket walkie, raises antenna.
Plissken...?
I'm here.
Where's the submarine? It's disappeared off our screens.

It's history. I gotta go. Plissken clicks off the walkie, pockets it, turns to clim hillside when... WHAM! Standing above him is a dark figure. Hooded. Carryi something huge and rounded at the ends. Plissken raises his submachine gun... ... as PIPELINE steps closer. He's a surfer in a black we Carries a surfboard. A rifle is slung across his shoulder Pipeline's face is raw, burned - too many hours surfing i

Too bad about your boat, man. (Plissken doesn't move) Supposed to be some swells out here tonight. Big ones. (beat) You like to surf? Realizing Pipeline is no danger, Plissken moves past him hillside.
You look kinda familiar. (beat) You hang out around here much? But Plissken's moved off into the darkness.

Plissken reaches old Mulholland Drive, now dark and desol Shells of houses stand nearby, black and empty. It has be rain. The sound of gunfire. Plissken ducks behind a tree... Two old cars come zooming up Mulholland, side by side. Wi down. Guns blazing at each other. They pass Plissken, con down Mulholland, ripping each other apart with gunfire. P darts across Mulholland, down the mountainside.
The rain pours down as Plissken makes his way down a stee incline. CRACK! A dark figure steps out from behind a tree. Plissk submachine gun ready. It's Pipeline.
Hey, man. I know who you are. You're Snake Plissken. Man, I can't believe you're really here. More gunfire from above on Mulholland...
Kind of a bad neighborhood, Snake.
Which way to the Hollywood Bowl?
(points) Down that way. Plissken starts down.
Be careful. Some real strange dudes hangin' out there these days. Plissken continues moving, now just a blurry figure in th
Hey Snake - what're you doin' around here, man? (as Plissken disappears) I heard they busted you up real good in Cleveland...

The rain is coming down in a torrent as Plissken makes hi down the hillside. Then, all at once, the rain lets up, t stops. The trees drip with moisture. Suddenly, a huge KAT above him. Plissken looks back. A huge mudslide is roarin down the hill toward him. Plissken races down the hill, but the mudslide cascades d like a freight train, catches up with him, sweeps him off feet... and Plissken goes riding down the hill, rumbling sliding in the mud.

The mudslide hits a flat area near a stand of trees, spre slows. A completely mud-covered, black Plissken climbs ou goo. He's dripping with it. His one good eye shines in th moonlight. He takes a couple steps toward the edge of the when...

Shut-up, fuck! Stop makin' noise! Plissken spins. He's standing right next to SPINAL, the l the Black Cowboy Gang. Dressed in black, boots with spurs duster, black cowboy hat, he carries an automatic rifle. just like Charles Barkley. Plissken looks around, realizes he's in the middle of a s of Black Cowboys, crouched behind the trees, waiting in a Covered with mud, Plissken blends right in.
Take cover, fool. Plissken jumps behind a tree, looks down the hillside.
Below his position is the Hollywood Bowl. A huge cross is stage, and the cross is on fire.
A group of white hooded men, the K.K.K., stand in front o burning cross holding a ceremony. Next to the cross on st hooded K.K.K. string quartet begins playing a Hayden conc Plissken reacts.
Let's take him. A Black Cowboy raises his M79 grenade launcher, as the ot quickly race down the hillside. He fires.

A 40mm armor-piercing grenade leaves a blazing fire trail rockets toward the burning cross and - KABLAMMO! A fireba pieces of the cross into the air. The K.K.K. spin around. A blast of lightning illuminates the Black Cowboys attack the hills. They open fire. A K.K.K. Grand Dragon is picke feet, buffeted in mid-air, flesh and robe shredded by gun hail of bullets hits the K.K.K. They return fire, but are overwhelmed. They are hit, jerking and twisting. Fire fro Black Cowboys is withering, racking the hooded figures li of lightning. The Black Cowboys keep advancing, firing, a starts to rain again. Through the cloudy wash of dribbling rain water, the fire continues. Four K.K.K. leap out from behind a row of seat jump Plissken, knocking his gun to the ground. In a blind flash, using hands, feet, and head, Plissken sends them f he reaches down to pick up his submachine gun, he sees th rain is washing the mud off his body... AND SO DOES SPINAL, who stands nearby, watching as Plissk washed clean by the rain. Spinal raises his weapon, then
Hey. I know you. Snake Plissken. Plissken slowly stands, his submachine gun in his hand. B them, the firefight is almost over. The K.K.K. scatter in rain...
Hey, what's going down, Snake?
I'm looking for somebody.
Who ain't? Plissken pulls out his tracer. It is blipping red, just s the Bowl.
Say, is it true what they say about Cleveland, man? Plissken doesn't answer. He moves on through the rain...
Later, Snake. Thanks for the help. You can always shift down and mojo with us anytime.
The ruins of the Capital Records building. The rain has s again. Plissken is a lone figure walking along the street distance, the sound of thumping music.

Pandemonium! Music blares. It's the old Supremes hit, "Lo Like An Itchin' In My Heart." Crowds dance in the street. like a block party. Black, Latino and Native American gan celebrate. Plus the usual Hollywood Boulevard street traf Plissken moves through the carnival. Gorgeous hookers sta the marquee of the ruined Chinese Theater. The marquee no
One of the hookers struts in front of Plissken.

Opening her mouth, she gives a sensuous puff. A polypropy orifice attached to the inside of her lips expands outwar small, pink balloon. She sucks it back in and puckers, ki air. Plissken turns, as the sounds of car engines rises.

... is a caravan of vehicles. The crowd parts to let them cheering insanely. Plissken ducks into an alley, watches. The caravan passes Plissken's position. Two men on horseb a convoy of rumbling, fuming old cars, buses, motorcycles scarred and ripped and jerry-rigged - bumps down the Boul Plissken watches from his spot in the alley, as a blonde- hooker joins him, rubs his arm. She has no polypropylene, none that we can see.
It's winnin' time, baby. How about you and I do some celebrating?
What's going on?
You must be new around here. (beat) You look familiar. Have I done you before? Plissken grabs the hooker.
What's happening?

Easy, man, easy. It's Cuervo Jones' gang. Mescalito Justice. He's the big boss man 'round here tonight. (whispers) He's gonna take down the police and make 'em kiss his fine ass. Plissken lets her go, stares...

... is perched ten feet off the ground on monster truck w Severed doll heads are glued all over the hood, and a lar glittering disco ball spins atop the roof, catching shard light and flicking them back into the night... Behind the disco ball stands the real Cuervo Jones, at le there next to him is Utopia. She's dressed in black lace and bra, garters and stockings. A Playboy fantasy. She ho prototype. Delgado, Cuervo Jones' second-in-command, stan her. He is huge and evil. Dressed like Pancho Villa. Plissken stares as the Cadillac passes. The hooker cheers with the rest of the crowd, and doesn't notice that Pliss moved off... Several motorcycles bring up the rear of the caravan. Mes ride with their women slung behind them. As the last bike Plissken darts out of the alley, yanks the woman off the the cycle, jumps on.

The Mescalito biker turns to react... WHACK! Plissken takes him out with a head-butt, shoves hi bike, hops up on the seat. KAVROOM! Plissken guns the motorcycle and it roars off, a other bikers, toward the head of the caravan. Plissken zo along, makes the turn onto La Brea Avenue with the carava
As the caravan turns west onto Sunset, Plissken blasts ar corner.
Coming right behind him are four Mescalitos on Harleys - iron bars, and swords in their hands. Plissken stares up

... is just a few feet away. Cuervo Jones and Utopia. Plissken guns it when suddenly two Mescalitos pull up on side of him. One of them swings a chain. Plissken grabs i one hand, and with his other hand, aims his submachine gu fires! The Mescalito and bike go flying, and Plissken hol the chain. Atop the Cadillac, Cuervo Jones reacts to the sound of gu turns to see...

As the other Mescalito riding behind him swings a chain. swings his. The two chains snap together, intertwining. T Plissken squeezes his hand-brake. He screeches to a stop. Mescalito keeps going, and is yanked over backward by his chain, off the Harley. Finally the Harley flops over, ski explodes. Plissken guns it again, takes off after the Cad Two more Mescalitos pull up on either side of Plissken. T aim at him with their automatic rifles. Plissken pulls a wheelie, lifts the front of his bike up into the air, rid back wheel. The two Mescalitos fire - directly into each They fall and their bikes go crashing to the pavement. Plissken surges the bike forward, coming up on a Mescalit horseback who turns and fires. Plissken ducks and the bul through the rear tire. The tire blows and the bike swerve control. Plissken leaps from the bike and grabs the back saddle.

Plissken pulls himself up behind the Mescalito and wrestl control of the mount. Plissken grabs the reins and wraps around the Mescalito's neck, squeezing until his eyes bur Plissken slams his arm against the Mescalito, throwing hi saddle, bouncing onto the pavement. Plissken gallops ahead, circling a lasso high above his h pounding down on a biker. The lasso takes flight and find mark, the biker's neck. Plissken pulls the lasso taut, ti end to the saddle horn, rides his mount parallel to the b
With one quick yank to the lasso, Plissken pulls the bike jumps on the bike and smacks the hell out of the horse's
Takes off down the street, dragging the biker by the neck

Speeds up as Plissken moves up to the Mustang five cars b swings off the bike and jumps onto the trunk. Plissken cl to the roof, leaps on the hood, then jumps to the trunk o in front - leapfrogging, jumping to the next car, the nex
Lean out their car windows, firing at him, but Plissken k moving toward the Cadillac...
Reaches out a car window and grabs Plissken's submachine Plissken turns to snatch it back -
Leaps from the Cadillac and takes Plissken down to the ro
Snake Plissken. They struggle. Cuervo raises his machete. Plissken grabs wrist, flips him over, knocks the machete off into the st smacks Cuervo in the face.
Comes roaring up on his bike, throws the bolas...

As the bolas hit him, wrap around his neck, the balls thu in the face, sending him flying... KAWHAP! Plissken hits the pavement hard. He skids, rolls, last slams into the edge of the sidewalk. The caravan rum down Sunset. The hand in the car window still holds Pliss submachine gun. Cuervo crouches on the roof, hissing at Plissken.
Later, Snake. We finish it later.
Lies there for several beats, then climbs to his feet.
... disappears up Sunset.

Stands alone in the deserted street. The ruins of a super cheap motels, liquor stores - all empty, desolate. He looks over to see the broken remains of his pocket wal After a beat, he starts moving up Sunset, checking his tw handguns, slipping them into their holsters.

On the border of Beverly Hills, Sunset stretches off into darkness beyond the intersection. A slight wind blows lit aimlessly along. There are occasional sounds: Creaks, dis clangs. Plissken approaches the intersection. He carries Utopia's homing device. It is silent. The small screen's blank. Th Plissken glances at his wrist watch.
Three hours gone. Plissken stands for a moment, staring off down Sunset...
Snake Plissken, right? He spins around.
Sits in an old beach chair on the sidewalk, a map to the sign in front of him. In his late 50's, he's a petty thie man. He's been hustling tourists and everybody else all h
Wow! Snake Plissken! Map To The Stars Eddie listens to WAYWARD WIND by Gogi Gr small, metal-plated portable radio. He clicks off the rad rises, walks over to Plissken.
You're a star in your own right, you know that? Hey, I'm Map To The Stars Eddie. How you doin'?
Where'd they go?
Man, I'd love to have your autograph, Snake. He searches around in his pockets, comes up with pen and

I've been hearing about you ever since that New York deal back in the 90's. You're one smooth operator. (offers pen and paper) Could you sign one to Wolf, one to Death's Head, one to Slasher Smith...? Plissken grabs him by the throat.
Where are they?

Who? You mean Cuervo Jones? He's the man with the juice, Snake. Got the President's daughter. Setting up a citywide truce. Big doings. Plissken draws a 9mm and points it at Map To The Stars Ed forehead.
Location.

Cuervo's got a place near Venice, where the big birds fly. Nice digs, too. I've been there, y'know. Plissken releases him, as suddenly the tracer beeps. On t Plissken sees a small red pulsing dot. West.

Nice little gizmo you got there. (whispers conspiratorially) Look, Snake. I've got connections in this town. You need something, I'm your man. Without a word Plissken turns, walks away down Sunset Bou toward Beverly Hills.
Hey - you can't go there, Snake. You can't walk through Beverly Hills. Plissken's figure disappears...
The old Beverly Hills sign. It's been painted over in dri letters: "QUIET - SURGICAL ZONE - STAY OUT" Plissken ignores the sign, keeps walking down a completel Sunset Boulevard.
Plissken walks past the once-beautiful mansions along Sun they are dark, ruined.

As a twisted, mechanical hand sewn awkwardly to the flesh wrist pulls aside a window curtain. The face behind the w in shadows, but we can just make out its pale, discolored features. The other hand brings up a walkie-talkie...
(into walkie) Specimen moving west on Sunset.
Plissken moves into the intersection of Sunset and Beverl The ruins of the old Beverly Hills Hotel are ahead and to right. He stops, stares down Sunset...
Emerges from the shadows. This is the gatekeeper. Strange mismatched body parts. A black-skinned arm attached to a white body. His face is unnaturally smooth - too many fac He carries a torch.
Halt! (beat) Where are you going? (no reply) Are you here for the auction?

Figures have suddenly moved out into the street, all with mismatched body parts - heads too large for their torsos, body parts mixed with male heads, all sewn together with uneven stitches. Plissken is surrounded.
Welcome to Beverly Hills. Plissken raises his gun, starts to move, when suddenly a rises behind him out of the shadows...
Raises a lead pipe, brings it down hard...
THUNK! He goes out like a light. As Plissken slumps unconscious to the street, the figures him. Their arms lock around him, drag him away with amazi - a pack of wolves on a deer.
Plissken bolts awake, to find himself tied to a cross. It lurching back and forth as though the ground is moving.

Plissken is being carried down Rodeo Driveon the cross by of surgical failures. They carry torches. Dressed in tatt Their faces look only partially human sewn together ragge Rodeo Drive is a bizarre marketplace of body parts. The o beautiful storefronts of famous designers are now in sham Human body parts are on display like filets of fish on ic Gucci now offers body pieces fashioned from spare car par Armani displays more eclectic, high priced pieces sewn to like sculptures in their windowfronts. A giant rift runs street's center. Acrid smoke rises. The throng stops at an intersection, and Plissken's cross anchored in the middle of the street. Surrounding the int are patients of every size, age, sex. Plissken looks over, sees another cross being carried up planted right next to his. A beautiful girl is tied to th This is TASLIMA, 20's, Iranian, the face of a Persian pri She's dressed in black leather, and basically has an IQ o 50.
Hi, Snake. It's so great to meet you. My name's Taslima. I'm a fan of yours.
Are you crazy?

A little bit. But pretty soon I'm gonna be dead. So are you, Snake. Plissken looks across the street. Our of the ruins of the famous red door of Elizabeth Arden come an arm of women f with acid-burned faces from one-too-many skin peelings wi knives, saws, horrible-looking carving instruments...
I can't believe I got caught. (sighs) I run with Midnight Jihad. Iranian gang. Only they kicked me out, cause I screw up sometimes. I forget stuff. Plissken struggles with his bonds.

I left my boyfriend's place tonight, took a wrong turn... (sighs again) Oh, Snake, I'm really kind of out of it sometimes. OUT OF THE RED DOOR come more interns and nurses carrying pans and pushing gurneys to collect dismembered body part The throng of facialists, patients, interns and nurses su Plissken and Taslima on the crosses. They move back to th sidewalks as the auction for body parts cut freshly from and Taslima is about to begin. The gurneys are wheeled in and set up as large cutting tables. The facialists take t positions behind the tables waiting to carve fresh meat.
What are they?

They live here, used to be like us. But after too many silicon implants, their muscles turned to jelly. The only way they survive is to have body parts transplanted over and over again. (whispers) Snake, nobody who comes into Beverly Hills gets out alive.
No screamin' shit.
Oh no, it's the Doctor.
Who?
The Surgeon General of Beverly Hills.

head_text.subj: THE DOCTOR, THE SURGEON GENERAL OF BEVERLY HILLS

text: Steps out into the street. He appears incredibly gorgeous of a man, put together by the finest body parts available Beverly Hills - a millennium Fabio - but upon closer exam he's got no lower jaw. Instead, there is a rusting metal attached beneath each ear. It never moves. He can actuall through a metal box attached to his windpipe.

Stands in front of them. He raises his hands to quiet the He walks around the cross, admiring the beautiful bodies him. He tickles the fine flesh with his right hand, which up of 10 gleaming scalpels which form a 360 degree cuttin
I've never seen more beautiful specimens. There will be no auction tonight. These body parts will go to those who need them the most. The crowd gumbles.

Turns his head sideways, to a small hidden pocket near hi With his teeth, he pulls out the silver mouth dart, slips his tongue, closes his mouth. The doctor raises his gleaming scalpel hand and steps tow Plissken.

What a beautiful blue eye. It's a shame you only have one. A nurse brings over a small step-ladder. The doctor posit in front of Plissken, slowly climbs up the rungs until he to face with him. The doctor looks ready to pluck Plisske eye from its socket with his scalpel tips. FFFTTT! Plissken spits the mouth dart! WHACK! The dark hits the doctor squarely in the forehead. freezes, his scalpel hand raised, his eyes clouding. He f forward. The scalpel hand swings, misses its mark, and instead hit rope tied around Plissken's wrist. WHATCK! The rope's cut Plissken grabs the scalpel hand with his free hand, cuts hand and legs loose in a flash and pushes the doctor back the step-ladder. WHUMP! Plissken falls to the intersection, almost at the as the doctor hits the pavement. The patients are stunned. Motionless. They stare at their lying in the street, moaning, moving slightly. Snake starts to run...
Snake, help me.
Why?
I don't know. Almost on a whim, Plissken cuts her free. Then he runs. T follows him. Plissken heads toward a side street, looks over his shoul Taslima following...
Don't follow me.
You need help.
Like hell I do. Then Plissken comes to a dead stop.
Comes a mass of patients right at him. Taslima grabs Plis pulls him with her. They take off down a dark cobblestone street...
Plissken and Taslima run as behind them the patient horde chase. They stop at another small alley between two large buildings.
Down this way. They disappear into the small alley.
It's long and narrow and completely enclosed by the build either side. Suddenly Plissken and Taslima come to the en foot high four-story building blocking the passageway to
This is a dead end. (looks at her) You took us into a dead end!

I just thought you wanted to get away. I didn't know you wanted to go someplace. KACLANK! They turn... The doctor staggers down the alley, the dart still sticki his forehead. Behind him, the patients follow... Plissken shoves Taslima toward a broken window.
Go! He follows Taslima through the window.

Plissken and Taslima climb dilapidated stairs, move along balcony railing. A torn and tattered Roy Lichtenstein pai hangs crooked on a wall. Twenty foot high bright red lett "CAA" - lie strewn across the marble floor. Various offic wrecked and dark, scripts lay all over the place. They stop at a dark hallway. Taslima moves cautiously ahe
Be careful of the bald cats. They live in these buildings.

The what? Plissken reaches for his other 9mm in its holder, but his are trapped by the doctor's body. Closer and closer moves dagger toward Plissken's good eye. Taslima scrambles, picks up Plissken's 9mm, then stares a men.

(yelling) Are you gonna stand there? Give me the gun! Taslima starts to hand it to him. Both Plissken and the d fight to reach it. Finally, it's in Plissken's grasp. He three times - each one hitting. The doctor shudders, roll Plissken gets to his feet. He blasts one more time for go measure, then follows Taslima down the hallway...
They come down a flight of stairs, stop at the rear door.
How do we get out of here?
Sewers. Come on. She pushes open the door...
Plissken and Taslima run from the building, as a chorus o rises. Patients swarm around the building in pursuit. Taslima stops at a sewer grate in the street.
Down there. Plissken lifts the grating. Taslima jumps in, followed by Plissken...

Dim, greenish light. Plissken and Taslima begin running d sewer tunnel. Through the hole behind them drop patients, chase. Plissken and Taslima race through a half-filled st seeping with slime. They turn a corner into another tunne run smack into a horde of patients. Instantly, the patien overpower them. Hands reach out and drag them down... Suddenly, from down the tunnel comes an unearthly sound, whispery screech like a demon unleashed from the underwor gets louder and louder. The patients freeze, then begin s and, as the sound gets louder still, they all disappear, back down the tunnel.
An eerie light appears, coming nearer and nearer every mo
Snake - what is it?

How the hell am I supposed to know? This is your damn city. Slowly, the light takes form. It is a single, gigantic ey floating in pitch-black darkness. It continues coming - g larger and larger. Suddenly the sewer begins to echo with blasting, ringing sound. Music! It's incredibly LOUD SALSA MUSIC! From out of the tunnel drives an ancient golf cart. On a metal pole in front is a huge, lighted eye such as a optometrist might use to advertise his services. Salsa mu blares at top volume from loudspeakers strapped to the si the cart. At the wheel of the vehicle is a large man dres jeans, cowboy boots and a flak vest, wearing a gas mask. is hooked to his belt. He pulls up near Plissken and Taslima, shuts off the moto music, lifts a shotgun from the seat beside him, climbs d holds the gun on them. Removing his head gear, his face becomes visible. He is P BOB, a Mexican wearing sunglasses under the gas mask. He the sunglasses, and his apparently blind in one eye. He l Los Lobos' lead guitarist.
What're you doing in here?
Looking to get out.
Good. I want you out. This is my sewer.
Which way? With a grunt of curiosity, Pendejo Bob moves up to Plissk Suddenly his blind eye flashes on like a tiny, built-in s With it, he examines Plissken's face.
You're Snake Plissken.
Yes. Isn't he cool? There is a clicking sound and the lighted eye is extingui Pendejo Bob extends his hand.
An honor, Snake. Amigo. They call me Pendejo Bob. Plissken doesn't shake. From down the tunnel the shouts a footfalls of the patients gets closer...
Those damn patients are coming back. You'd better climb aboard. Plissken and Taslima climb into the rear of the golf cart Bob spins the cart, takes off in the other direction.
The golf cart streaks along through a dark sewer passage. light comes from the eye on the front of the vehicle.

I use the eye and the music to scare em off. They're so whacked out, man, it works great. Chased a whole bunch of em right off the edge there a few months ago. He points to a sheer, pitch-black drop-off on one side of passage.
(she peers over the side) How far down does it go?
Don't know - never do hear em land. Earthquake opened it up. The golf cart creaks into a narrow tunnel...
Guards, Hispanics in biker denims, fatigues, with rifles sunglasses, line the walls. They watch as the golf cart p ahead is a door marked: "SEWAGE RECLAMATION CONTROL"

The cart pulls into the remains of a mammoth underground center. It's lined with ladders, catwalks, machines full and levers. A few are still working - most are broken and with dust and grime. Filling the room is an underground enclave: Men, women, c all Hispanic, living in tents and lean-to's, cooking over fires next to old rusted cars on blocks, lots of weapons, sunglasses. Also, high-tech, futuristic rifles, cannons, launchers - an amazing arsenal. Crates of explosives are everywhere. The golf cart comes to a stop and they get off.

I own this whole place. Used to work here in the old days. I was right in this room when the big one hit. What a mess. We were waist high in shit. (turns proudly to them) Everybody else ran, but not me. I stayed at my post. Now it's all mine. I brought my whole family, my amigos, down here to live with me.
Gun runners.
Hey, it's a living, baby.
Why don't you get out of L.A.? Take a boat to China, take an airplane to Brazil? (looks at Taslima) Earthquakes, death, shit. Why do you stay?
I don't know. Somehow, I just can't leave.
Y'know, L.A.'s not such a bad place, Snake. We got our problems, sure - but this is paradise, man. Pendejo Bob leans in close and whispers conspiratorially Plissken.
Say, you need anything, Snake? Guns? Explosives? I can get you a crate of hellfire grenades, no problem - five hours.
Yeah. So how do I get to Venice?

All the sewers are collapsed under Venice. You have to go topside. Right up there. He leads Plissken and Taslima to a ladder that goes up in darkness. A line of men steadily climb up, one after the carrying crates of weapons.
Comes out near the Santa Monica Freeway. Just follow the signs. Get off at the Lincoln Exit, turn left. Pendejo Bob interrupts the line of men. Plissken starts u ladder, followed by Taslima...
Nice to meet you, Snake. You too, Miss. You're welcome down here anytime. Anytime at all.

location: STREET UNDER SANTA MONICA FREEWAY OVERPASS

text: Plissken, gun in hand, sticks his head out of the open gr Taslima follows. The Hispanic men who have climbed up out sewers load their weapons crates into various low-rider c heavily-armed groups. They rumble off into the night. Taslima points to a freeway on-ramp.
The freeway's over there. But, Snake - I don't think it's such a good idea. Plissken starts toward the on-ramp. Taslima doesn't move.
The freeways are dangerous. He keeps walking.
Goodbye, Snake. Plissken stops, turns back, looks at her - a half-smile. close to 'thank you' as he gets.
Sun's coming up in a few hours. She walks up to him.

UV's gonna be bad today. I have a friend who's got a place near here. We can crash there if you want, Snake. (she moves close to him) I'd love to take care of you. Make you feel good. Without an answer Plissken turns and walks away...

As far as the eye can see there are lines of rusting cars trucks, bumper to bumper like a giant junkyard rush hour. Plissken walks up the on-ramp, onto the freeway. He strid rows of junked cars. A few of them have people inside... There is a Mercedes rusted to its frame, its driver an 80 in sunglasses, drinking from a bottle. A pickup truck ful illegal aliens packed in like sardines. Someone cooks fro barbecue grill. An RV. An old man sits in the opened door staring at Plissken as he passes. Two old ladies in house stare at him through the windows. CLICK, CLICK! A sound behind Plissken. He spins, 9mm read It's Taslima, running to catch up with him.
I changed my mind. I'm going with you, wherever you're going.
(gestures to the cars) What the hell is this?
The freeway.
I know that. There are people in some of these cars.

It's where they live. I guess after everything happened, they just needed to do what they'd always done before. During the daytime, they just pull down the shades on their windows and sleep. Plissken continues walking. Taslima catches up...
What are you gonna do in Venice?
Find Cuervo Jones.
No! Stay away, Snake. He's mucho muerte. Suddenly a shot rings out. Taslima is struck and falls. P drops between the cars and crawls over to her.
Run, Snake...They're coming.
Who? She touches his hand and looks at him softly.
I don't know. Taslima dies. Plissken stares at her for a moment. More shots ring out - landing very close to him.

From out of the heavy bushes along the freeway storm a do Mescalitos moving quickly - firing as they go. Behind the an ancient garbage truck mounted with a 50-caliber machin Atop the truck is Delgado. He wears a flame thrower on hi
Returns fire, rolls under a car and begins crawling. All him people jump out of their cars, begin firing back at t Mescalitos.
Smashes through a rusting Volkswagen, heading straight to
Reaches the edge of the freeway, dives for the bushes.
Roars past, firing into the vehicles on the freeway, the running, screaming...
Clawing his way through the undergrowth, Plissken bursts side street. Behind him come the Mescalitos on foot. Plis runs, firing back every step of the way...

Suddenly, in the blowing mist in front of him, a car scre into view. It's a perfectly restored, 1966 Cadillac conve Candy-apple red. The stereo blasts "Last Night" by the Sa And behind the wheel is Map To The Stars Eddie.
Hop in, Snake!

As the garbage truck bursts through. Delgado is behind th gun, blasting away, burning up the street. Bullets are fl everywhere as Plissken runs to the Cadillac and dives int back seat. He's still not fully inside when Map To The St roars away in a blaze of rubber and smoke.
Takes aim with his flame thrower... KAWHOOSH!
Shoots out from the nozzle like a flaming spear. It strea the street, just missing the tail of the Cadillac as it s around a corner...
Map To The Stars Eddie races along a dark street. Plisske into the front seat.

Hey, Snake - that was great. They almost burned your ass off! Map To The Stars Eddie drives like Satan himself. Plisske almost thrown out as they spin around curves, up onto sid Delgado and the garbage truck can't keep up with them. Fi the Mescalitos are left far behind as Map To The Stars Ed down to a cruise of 70.
Too many people know where you're going, Snake. That's not good. Delgado and his men were back there waiting for you.
Delgado?
Cuervo Jones' right-hand man. One tough hombre. You don't understand, Snake. Cuervo Jones wants to unify the island. We're on the move, man. Big time.
The Cadillac smashes through an intersection, knocking tw junked cars out of the way.
Plissken jams his 9mm into Map To The Stars Eddie's ear.
Stop the damn car.
No way.
I said pull over.
All right. Anything for you, Snake. (beat) Although I was going to take you to Cuervo Jones' place. Plissken lowers the gun.
Where is it?
Right over there. He points. Plissken looks off, as Map To The Stars Eddie button on the steering wheel with his finger.
A small panel in front of Plissken flips down, revealing inch machine gun barrel. Before he can do anything, four rip straight into his chest, blasting him into the seat.

Grits his teeth and gasps. His gun drops. Blood runs from holes in his shirt. His face grows red as he fights for a Map To The Stars Eddie pushes the button again and the pa closes up over the barrel.
Pretty neat, huh? This is Cuervo's car. He lets me use it sometimes. (looks at Plissken) Not to worry, Snake. You were just shot with a fun-gun. You feel it? Plissken gulps for air.
Pure mesh, man. 100-proof artery choker. Plissken slumps back, collapses in the seat.
Like Cuervo says, when the hit pulls you down to one inch from death, that is living, man.
Kicks in hard. Surreal colors float through the dark, dev streets of Venice. Plissken fights desperately against the drug, but he can'
You should've talked to me first, Snake. I could've set this whole thing up. I'm actually Cuervo's agent, you know. As Plissken sags, losing consciousness, Map To The Stars voice begins to fade...

And I'd love to represent you, too. We could make a bundle together. I know I could really help your career...I mean, you're a legend and all - but the last couple years, man, it's like you've fallen off the face of the earth.
As the world crashes to black!

Like a giant, scorched daddy-long-legs, the architectural of the LA airport rises above the empty parking lot litte the skeletal remains of burned-out cars and airport shutt wrecks of old 747s lie twisted and bent across the tarmac
Surrounded by Mescalitos with torches and guns, sits the Bradley Terminal defaced with graffiti, the sign now read
Opens. Looks around fuzzily.

He is in Cuervo Jones lair. Huge. Torch-lit. Plissken lie center of the room, chained to a treadmill. He is surroun Mescalitos. In one corner of the room is lots of high-tech equipment. Computers. A VR simulator. Most of the Mescalitos are gat around a big screen TV. They watch the 207th Annual Acade from Carefree, Arizona. Cuervo Jones strides toward Plissken. Map To The Stars Ed scurries along at his side.
Come on, Cuervo. I delivered him, didn't I? All I'm asking for is what you promised.
We'll see. Cuervo Jones stops in front of Plissken. Sees that he's a Holds out a glass filled with red liquid.

Carrot juice? (no response) Laced with tequila, Snake. Good for you. No? (no response) Your health. Cuervo Jones downs the carrot juice. Plissken lifts his h grimaces. Sweat pours down his face. He gasps for air.
You're coming out of it, Snake. It hurts real bad. (beat) That's good. He kneels down next to Plissken.
Dying isn't good enough for you. You need pain. You'll never make it to where you want to go without a little pain. He stands, considers Plissken for a moment.
Snake Plissken. American outlaw. So typical of American idealism. The old west, Snake. Cuervo Jones tosses the glass to Map To The Stars Eddie. beginning to enjoy the moment, performing for Plissken.

Man against the sky. The individual. Freedom. No wonder they hate you so much in America, Snake. You remind them of what they used to be. Cuervo Jones walks to a door, opens it. Beyond is a huge filled with people - families, teenage runaways, the elde illegal aliens, orphans - people with nowhere to go. They being fed and cared for by Mescalitos.
Here is the real L.A., Snake. Plissken lifts his head to see.
The poor. The old. The lost. People without hope. He crosses back to Plissken...
Do you know what they want? One word. Liberation. (beat) They want a chance to live - before it's all gone. They've been hated for too long

(smiles) Now it's their turn. He gestures to his men, who move to Plissken and begin ca unlocking him from the treadmill. Still wobbly, Plissken crawls to his feet... As Utopia comes bounding up from the big screen TV. Still in her racy underwear, she gives Cuervo Jones a kiss. She carries the prototype with her.
Cuervo! LaToya Jackson just won Best Actress. Cuervo Jones reaches out to take the prototype from her. on to it.
You said I could hold it. He yanks it out of her hands, more violently than she exp Recovering, she casts a contemptuous glance at Plissken.
Who's that?
You never heard of Snake Plissken? Utopia takes a couple steps closer, squints.
He doesn't look like his picture. (frown) I bet he's fake.
Now go get dressed. We have things to do.
Are we going to eat soon? I'm starved. Cuervo Jones gives her a slap on the butt, which startles
Ooww!
Go on now. Do as I say. Plissken watches as Utopia walks away, out of the termina

I'm going to show her what it means to be a woman - for the first time in her pathetic little life. (smiles) Given her love, Snake. Everybody needs love. He moves slightly closer to Plissken - though not too clo

You want to hook up with us? Join the revolution? We're all getting out of here tomorrow night. (holds up the prototype) We're gonna rule the world. Come with us, Snake. Plissken says nothing. His good eye glares.
No? Too bad. Well, I told you we'd finish it later. So guess what? It's later. He motions to his men, who grab Plissken and drag him awa

The baggage claim area is an industrial wasteland filled machinery and hanging cables and wires. A door opens and is hurled in. The door slams shut. Plissken stands a moment, trying to get his balance, when steps out of the shadows. It is Delgado.
You're mine now, Snake. All mine. Delgado slowly moves towards Plissken, swinging two huge machetes around his head. Plissken steps back, glances at wrist watch. 4 hours and 20 minutes gone.

Shit. Plissken looks up as Delgado flings a machete at him. He barely dives out of the way, rolls on the floor... Delgado charges toward him, machete poised like a bayonet Plissken rips off an edge guard from the baggage carousel wings it at Delgado. The machete is blocked with a direct

Delgado is thrown sideways. Plissken runs, launches himse through the air, twisting his body sideways, and lands a right in Delgado's face. Delgado goes sprawling. One of t machetes CLANKS to the floor... Plissken grabs the machete, just as Delgado rises... WHOOSH! Plissken's arm is a blur as he throws... THUMP! The machete sticks out of Delgado's chest. He look it in horror, then crumbles to the floor.

The caravan is starting up again. Wearing hot pants, a ta and full-length mink coat, Utopia is escorted up a ladder Cuervo Jones to the opened door of the Cadillac perched u those monster truck wheels. The other Mescalitos mount up cars and motorcycles, and roar away from the terminal. Above, on top of the terminal, see a figure move.
It's Plissken. He grabs an electrical wire and throws it side...

Stands watching the caravan pull away. He doesn't see the dangling behind him, and Plissken shinnying down it. Beat. Beat. WHACK! Plissken takes him out with one blow, lowers himse ground, takes his rifle. Plissken quickly moves down the dark street after the car

Cuervo Jones' caravan comes rolling down Manchester, into parking lot toward the Forum. Portions of the gigantic sp arena have been damaged in the earthquake, but crowds sti into the entrances. The caravan pulls up at the Forum Club entrance. Cuervo J Utopia, Map To The Stars Eddie and the others enter.
Approaches, ducks behind an old junked car.
Plissken sneaks up to a crumbled, broken wall of the Foru inside through a large crack...
Plissken's in the backstage area, near the locker rooms. cheering from the main arena. Slowly Plissken moves to a opens it, steps out...

The cheering is louder is Plissken makes his way along th hallway. Now the sound of gunfire from someplace up ahead. Plisske Suddenly from down the hallway come two Black Muslims car body on a stretcher. As they pass, Plissken notices the b wearing a bloody basketball uniform full of bullet holes. He moves forward...

Plissken peers into the main arena. A basketball game is The Korean Dragons sit on one side, the Black Muslims on other. They cheer wildly for their respective teams. Pipe in the crowd, enjoying the game... Plissken moves closer, among the crowd along the baseline whole place is lit by torches and clumsily-wired lighting his head is the shot clock, slowly ticking down. There's blood everywhere on the floor. The referees wear proof body suits and helmets. Trainers with stretchers st
Ticks down: 5 - 4...
Dribbles the ball towards the basket.
Ticks down: 3 - 2... A whole row of Korean Dragons with rifles stand and take

Pulls up into a jump shot, releases the ball into the air sails through the basket just as the horn goes off, beati 24-second violation. The Black Muslim crowd cheers. The Korean Dragons sit dow Plissken watches...

head_text.subj: CUERVO JONES, UTOPIA AND THE OTHERS

text: Moving through the seats on the Korean Dragon side of the Map To The Stars Eddie stands near the baseline, listenin game on his silver portable radio...
Hands the ball to a Korean Dragon guard. The Korean Drago dribbles the ball down court, into the corner and passes The Korean Dragons can't get a shot off...
Above Plissken's head ticks down: 5 - 4 - 3 - 2 - 1... HO
Guard still has the ball - the shot clock horn has gone o second violation. A whole row of Black Muslims with rifles stand up, take a fire!
The Korean Dragon guard is riddled with bullets. He falls the floor. The Trainers with stretchers quickly collect h and hurry off the court. Ball boys quickly wipe up the blood with mops.

(sound of effect of breaking glass) Shot clock! The Black Muslim crowd is cheering and screaming! "I Love begins playing on the loudspeaker. The players wear do-rags and black uniforms that look a w like the black leather that Plissken wears. One of the pl JAMAAL, notices Plissken.
Hey - Snake Plissken, you knew my brother Abdul. He was with you in Cleveland. The other players react, greet Plissken, slapping his han thumping chests, high-fiving each other.
Welcome aboard, Snake. But Plissken pays no attention. He sees:
Sitting in the Korean Dragon section near the other end o court.

Sit next to Xi-Ping, the leader of the Korean Dragons, a man with green and brown psychedelic camouflage on his fa Utopia watches the game while the two men confer. Cuervo a firm grip on the prototype.
The time is now. We are the strongest. If we go together, the others will come. (beat) We go for everything, Xi-Ping. But we go together. What do you say? Xi-Ping nodes. They clasp hands...
Realizes he's got to get to the other side of the court. into the huddle with Jamaal, peering at him with his one cold eye.
Your brother died owing me, so I'm taking it out in trade. I need a favor...
Sure, Snake. Anything.
I need to get across the court now... without drawing attention to myself.

Like you ain't gonna stick out like a sore thumb. But we'll do what we can, Snake. Use the clock. Screen and roll. Now let's kick some butt! The players knock fists. Plissken puts on a do-rag. Yelli move onto the court, creating a shield for Plissken.
(whispers) You play much pick-up ball, Snake? Plissken's watching Cuervo Jones and Utopia at the other

Whatever happens, watch the shot clock, man. The referee blows his whistle. A Black Muslim guard inbou ball. The game is underway. Plissken ducks down the court using the rest of his team They go into a set play. The game is a cross between basketball and kung-fu. Playe slashing fists, spin-kicks, elbows and hard back-hands. I combat. The Korean Dragon guarding Plissken chops him. Plissken k flat. No foul. Utopia sees Plissken, nudges Cuervo Jones.
It's that weird guy again. Cuervo Jones grabs her and heads for the exit... Plissken sees this, stops playing, moves after them... wh suddenly the basketball lands right in his hands!
Snake! Shot clock!

Ticks down: 4 - 3 - 2... A whole row of Korean Dragons with rifles stand up, take Plissken. Cuervo Jones watches expectantly... Plissken spins, executes a beautiful-looking jump shot. T sounds just as it leaves his hand...

Swish. Nothing but net. The Korean Dragons sit back down, put away their rifles, disappointed. Cuervo Jones, Utopia, Xi-Ping and their hen quickly leave. The Black Muslims go crazy, and Plissken d toward one of the exits. He stops, sees...
With his portable radio, trying to get out of the arena, behind a crowd of Dragons. Plissken races through the cro Map To The Stars Eddie.
Hey, Snake, man... Great shot! Without hesitation, Snake whacks him across the jaw. Map Stars Eddie goes down like a sack of laundry. Plissken gr by the collar, drags him off toward an exit...
Cuervo Jones, Utopia, Xi-Ping and their men rush out to t caravan of waiting vehicles. Xi-Ping has his own armada o vehicles and an army of evil-looking guards. Cuervo Jones Xi-Ping aside.
That man in black. He's very dangerous.
One eye?
Yes. We gotta dump him.
What does he want?
(glances at the prototype) I'm betting the cops sent him in. Man, I do not need this. I got a war to win.
As Plissken drags Map To The Stars Eddie out into the nig crouches behind a row of cars, watches Cuervo Jones' cara their engines. Plissken shakes Map To The Stars Eddie, waking him...
Where are they going?
(groggy) Oh, man... You didn't have to hit me, Snake. I can help you. Plissken shoves the barrel of his pistol up against Map T Stars Eddie's temple.

Bankrupt City. The Happy Kingdom. (beat) Snake, Cuervo's hooked up with Xi-Ping. He is primetime, man - Mister Bad News. The rest of the city's joining up with 'em. (beat) You're shit outta luck, Snake. Plissken reaches into a pocket, comes out with the large clip, slips it on his 9mm pistol.
Not yet.

I could've helped you. We coulda made a deal with Cuervo. If you'd listen... Without looking, Plissken slams his elbow into Map To The Eddie's jaw with a WHACK! He flops unconscious on the pav Cuervo Jones' caravan led by that huge Cadillac on monste moves away from the Forum toward an exit. Plissken moves them, ducking behind the row of cars...

The caravan picks up speed as it approaches the exit... Plissken appears behind an old truck, just as the Cadilla past him. He crouches on the balls of his feet, and as th the Caddy drifts closer, he springs... And grabs on to the rear bumper. The monster wheels spin huge, black scythes on either side of him. Plissken reach the Caddy, finds a purchase on the undercarriage, and swi the Cadillac. He hangs dangling above the street by one h the caravan pulls out onto Manchester. With the other he his 9mm and aims it at the undercarriage, right about whe front seat should be...

The front seat explodes, bullets screaming upward through leather seats, tearing and shredding fabric and flesh, ki driver and Xi-Ping instantly! In the back seat sit Cuervo Jones and Utopia. The Caddy b swerve, the wheel spinning. Cuervo Jones lunges forward a seat and grabs it. Under the Cadillac, Plissken continues to fire: BLAM, BLA
The front seat disintegrates. Metal, leather, padding fly everywhere. Cuervo Jones ducks against the door, covering with one hand, still grasping the wheel with the other.

The entire front seat and floor underneath it fall down o Cadillac and hit the street below. The bodies of the driv Ping flop under the monster wheels. Plissken swings over to the hole and pulls himself up int opening that used to be the front seat. Cuervo Jones star in total shock, but before he can speak... Plissken rips the prototype out of his hands! Then jumps back seat next to Utopia. Then grabs her and turns to the door. Cuervo Jones releases the wheel for a moment, turns Plissken... But Plissken opens the side door, kicks it wide, and with under his arm, slides across the seat... ... and sails out of the Cadillac...

No! Plissken and Utopia fly through the air, and land with a top of a Mescalito car as the Cadillac begins to swerve w Cuervo Jones grabs the wheel, desperately tries to contro Caddy... but fails. The Cadillac careens off the street, into the palm tree, spins around and crashes into the rem hot dog stand.

head_text.subj: ON THE ROOF OF THE MESCALITO CAR

text: Plissken and Utopia roll and tumble. He still has a hold and she fights him tooth and nail...
Lemme go...!
The driver swerves, hits the brakes... and the car hops t slides along the sidewalk, burning rubber.

Are thrown forward. They tumble off the roof... across th and land on the sidewalk in front of the car. They roll t as the car screeches to a stop, inches from their heads, caravan suddenly puts on its brakes. Screaming tires. Cars jackknifing, spinning in a massive collision... Cuervo Jones emerges from the remains of the Cadillac. Plissken drags Utopia into the street, grabs the lid of a in the street, pries it up... Mescalitos pour out of their vehicles, as Cuervo Jones ch into the street, pointing at Plissken...

Kill him, kill him...! Plissken lifts Utopia to her feel, hauls her over to the opening, and dives inside... just as the Mescalitos open street around the manhole opening explodes with screaming lead...
Plissken and Utopia land in the half-filled storm drain. to his feet, pulls her with him, and heads off sloshing t the water. The sound of gunfire echoes above them...
Cuervo Jones and the Mescalitos charge the open manhole a The Stars Eddie appears groggily shuffling up the street Forum...
(grins to himself) Good thinkin', Snake. He heads off down the street...
Plissken and Utopia race along through the water. He lite to drag her with him. They turn a corner, go down another drain away from the main tunnel...
The black belly of the sewer system. Plissken and Utopia along, slow as they come to...

One side of the passage, the same one we saw earlier on o journey with Pendejo Bob. Plissken spins Utopia around, pushes her backward toward off, his eye burning into her... Her feet reach the very edge. Plissken holds her there. Utopia's face is a mask of shee She gulps air in staccato bursts... Beat. Beat. Plissken can't do it. He can't push her off. He releases her, backs up, looks at the prototype, then p of his revolvers from its holster, cocks the hammer, aims
My... father sent you... didn't he? (beat) He sent you to kill me... Plissken raises the pistol. She's dead in his sights.
Didn't he? (begins to cry) But Plissken can't. He can't kill her. The toughest man o Earth can't kill this 17-year-old runaway.
Shit. Plissken sags, clicks the hammer back, holsters the gun. at her.
Get out of here. Utopia wipes her eyes, confused, afraid.
I said go! Slowly Utopia moves from the edge of the drop off, starts down the tunnel, then stops, looks back at Plissken. She the prototype in Plissken's hand...
Don't take it back. Don't give it to him. Please. Let me have it. Plissken glances at the prototype, then at her.
What does this thing do?
(her eyes grow wide) No!
Plissken's shoulder explodes as a bullet tears through hi He spins, drops the prototype... ... as Map To The Stars Eddie emerges from the darkness o sewer tunnel. He holds a gun in one hand, aims...

He fires again, hits Plissken's leg. Plissken staggers backward toward the edge of the drop of To The Stars Eddie moves quickly forward... ... and snatches the prototype from the wet floor. Plissken's gun hand is useless, numb from the shoulder wo slowly, painfully transfers the pistol to the other hand, raise it...
So long, Snake. Map To The Stars Eddie takes aim - a head shot ... Plissken spins, and dives off the edge... ... down into the drop off...

Airborne. Falling through black space. Down, down, down, to hell below, until we can't see him anymore as the dark swallows him up... Map To The Stars Eddie steps to the ledge, looks down, as Jones and his Mescalitos slog up through the tunnel.
Where is he?
He jumped. Down there. (beat) He's dead, Cuervo. I did it. I killed Plissken. Cuervo Jones looks over the edge, at the silent blackness Then he turns to Map To The Stars Eddie.
Give it to me.
You said I could be Vice-President, Cuervo. Your right-hand man.
(extends his hand) Give it.
